snippet: A frustrated Tiger Woods fell 12 shots off the lead at the Masters, and he hurled his club to the ground after an errant shot on the 13th hole.
abstract: Tiger Woods falls 12 shots off the lead at the Masters, and in frustration hurl his club to the ground after an errant shot on the 13th hole; display of petulance could be costly, as the PGA Tour has the right to discipline players for unprofessional conduct, even in events like the Masters that it does not run but co-sponsors or approves.
lead_paragraph: A frustrated Tiger Woods fell 12 shots off the lead at the Masters, and he hurled his club to the ground after an errant shot on the 13th hole.

headline.seo: Woods Loses His Temper and More Ground at Masters
headline.main: Flustered Woods Loses Temper and More Ground
headline.print_headline: Flustered Woods Loses Temper and More Ground
